Package world

Class Level

java.lang.Object
world.Level
public class Level extends Object
Handles the tile arrangement of the world in which entities interact.

  • Constructor Details

    • Level

      public Level(int l)
      Constructs a new Level object from one of the pre-defined levels.
      Parameters:
      l - the level number corresponding to one of the LEVEL_* strings in this class.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if m does not represent an existing level.

  • Method Details

    • toInteger

      public int toInteger()
      Returns the integer choice of this level. The returned integer is l such that new Level(l).equals(this) == true.
      Returns:
      the integer choice of this level.

    • fromString

      public static Level.Tile[][] fromString(String str)
      Loads a level as a 2d tile array from a string representation. The string form of a level is defined as:
      • Rows are separated by a newline character "\n"
      • A single character represents one tile
      • All rows are the same length
      • The pound sign "#" represents a WALL
      • The space " " represents NONE
      • The capital c "C" represents a CRATE
      Parameters:
      str - the string to parse as a 2d tile array.
      Returns:
      the parsed 2d tile array. If any character is not recognized but the string is otherwise valid, then the unknown char is assumed to be a NONE tile.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if str == null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given string is empty.
      IllegalArgumentException - if any row is empty.
      IllegalArgumentException - if any two rows have a different number of columns.

    • get

      public Level.Tile get(int r, int c)
      Gets the tile at a specific row and column.
      Parameters:
      r - the row.
      c - the column.
      Returns:
      the Tile object on the level at the specified location.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if r or c are not in the bounds of the level size.

    • isFilled

      public boolean isFilled(int r, int c)
      Determines if the specified tile is filled by a non-passable block.
      Parameters:
      r - the row.
      c - the column.
      Returns:
      whether the specified tile is filled by a non-passable block.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if r or c are not in the bounds of the level size.

    • rows

      public int rows()
      Returns the number of rows in this level.
      Returns:
      the number of rows in this level.

    • cols

      public int cols(int r)
      Returns the number of columns in a given row.
      Parameters:
      r - the row to get the number of columns in.
      Returns:
      the number of columns in the given row.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if r is not in bounds of the size of the level.

    • collides

      public boolean collides(Moveable moveable, double vx, double vy)
      Determines if an object moving with some velocity will collide with any solid tile on the level in the next frame.
      Parameters:
      moveable - the Moveable object to check collision with.
      vx - the x component of the velocity that the object will have.
      vy - the y component of the velocity that the object will have.
      Returns:
      true if the object will collide with any solid tile on the level with its current position and given velocity.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the size of the object as determined by Moveable::getSize() is greater than 1 tile.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the position of the object is not on the level.
